definition: lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: Arch dam construction in China has developed and the quantity stands first.
sentences.chinese: 我国拱坝建设也后来居上，数量已是世界第一。

sentences.english: Who knows what happened to that hand-out, but we came from far behind to win.
sentences.chinese: 谁知道发生了什么事，我们却后来居上获得了订单。

sentences.english: We're going to come from behind and win this game, coach.
sentences.chinese: 我们将后来居上，赢得这场比赛，教练。

definition: to overtake
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to try hard to catch up
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
most outstanding/par excellence
key moment/decisive opportunity
to vault
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
